intro: Quararibea cryptantha, commonly known as the cryptantha guarea, is a small evergreen tree native to the rainforests of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters. Its fruits are capsules that release tiny seeds when mature. Quararibea cryptantha is valued for its ornamental appeal and has some traditional uses in local medicine.
